info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 1:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND BERKELEY COUNTIES... At 116 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Hampton Plantation State Park to near McClellanville to 6 miles east of Awendaw, and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these storms include... McClellanville, Cape Romain, Santee Coastal Reserve, Hampton Plantation State Park, Cape Island and Lighthouse Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
